intro: Corydalis vyschinii, commonly known as the Yarlungzangbo Corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the Tibetan Plateau. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred petals and clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude meadows and rocky slopes, adapting to the harsh environmental conditions of its habitat. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while the stems are slender and branching. Corydalis vyschinii is valued for its ornamental appeal and is also studied for its potential medicinal properties.
